result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

final pretrial checklist
filed by defense

Ct 1: 961.41(3g)(d)-PCS Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin (2+); Ct 2: 946.41(1)-Resisting/Obstructing. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Patrick D Gordon in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Robin Anderson. TRANSCRIPT FILED 05-15-2015/tk
The State has filed amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt of same, waives its reading and enters NG plea. Parties are ready to proceed to trial next week.
Ludwig hearing will be conducted prior to voir dire. State's MIL are granted. Defense MIL granted with the exception of #10. #11 will be granted except as to any expert. The fact that the deft had a warrant at the time of the stop is not to be relayed to the jury. #2 in the defense's second MIL is denied. The Court will allow the officer to testify that the area is a high crime area. The State orally makes a motion to modify bond in this case to a more substantial bond. All witnesses are available for trial for both parties.  Anticipated lenght of trial is 1 day. 1 alternate, 5 strikes.  Preliminary jury instructions that will be given are 50, 103, 148, 55, 58, 300, 130, 101. 

BTC: Bond to be modfied to $1000.00 cash. Same terms and conditions previously ordered remain. **DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY**  JT remains
